Section.name: About Daita Sriramulu Hindu College of Law
Section.description:
Daita Sriramulu Hindu College of Law is one of the oldest self-financed college in Andhra Pradesh to impart a high quality legal education. The College was established and founded in the year 1982-1983 with the permission of Bar Council of India, New Delhi by “The Hindu High & Branch School Society” (Estimated., in 1896) under the able guidance of Late Daita Madhusudana Sastry, an educationist and a prominent advocate. The college is affiliated to Acharya Nagarjuna University located in machlipatnam.It offers 3 Year LL.B., Degree Course with an intake of 60 Students per Section. Prominent judges of Andhra Pradesh high court visits the college as chief guests on annual functions and awards medals and prizes to the meritorious students every year.
The Institution has well furnished infrastructure and is run by highly qualified and experienced staff. The college library is well equipped with text books, reference books, journals, social welfare department books etc. The administrative office of the college caters to the need of prominent and prospective students.The college also organizes moot court sessions , interaction with district court as a part of academic activities initiated by the institution.
